snippet: Chris Christie’s prospects of being Mitt Romney’s No. 2 pick seem to be fading, and the New Jersey governor is trying to reconcile pursuit of the spotlight with his job.
abstract: Republicans close to Mitt Romney's presidential campaign say that they fear New Jersey Gov Chris Christie is too unpredictable and too contentious, and as a result his potential as a vice-presidential pick is fading; if Christie is not chosen, it would inevitably raise questions about his future in national politics.

byline.contributor: Michael Barbaro contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: Chris Christie’s prospects of being Mitt Romney’s No. 2 pick seem to be fading, and the New Jersey governor is trying to reconcile pursuit of the spotlight with his job.

headline.seo: Christie Balancing National Ambitions With Governorship
headline.main: Christie’s Brashness Blunts His Hopes to Run With Romney
headline.print_headline: Christie’s Brashness Blunts Hopes to Join Ticket
